data.title: Here are the Orange County athletes at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio

The 22-year-old and his doubles partner, Sattawat Pongnairat, […]
data.text:
MAP: Where Southern California athletes are from:

From badminton to wrestling, 33 athletes with Orange County ties will take part in the Summer Games in Brazil.

BADMINTON

PHILLIP CHEW AND JAMIE SUBANDHI

Events: Men’s doubles and mixed doubles

His hometown: Orange

Her hometown: Westminster

Chew’s Bio: Chew will make his Olympic debut in Rio. The 22-year-old and his doubles partner, Sattawat Pongnairat, won gold at the 2015 Pan American Games and are No. 35 in the world rankings as of July 21. He and Westminster native Jamie Subandhi are the first U.S. mixed doubles pair to qualify for the Olympic Games. They are No. 27 in the world rankings (as of July 21).

Subandhi Bio: Subandhi joined forces with Phillip Chew to become the first U.S. mixed doubles athletes to qualify for the Olympic Games. The pair won gold at the 2015 Pan American Games in Toronto and are No. 27 in the world rankings as of July 21.

EVA LEE

Event: Women’s doubles

Hometown: Diamond Bar

College: UC Irvine

Bio: A veteran of the 2008 Beijing Games, Lee is returning to the Olympics for her second go. She and her women’s doubles partner, Paula Lynn Obanana, won gold at the 2015 Pan American Games in Toronto and are No. 26 in the world rankings as of July 21.

SATTAWAT PONGNAIRAT

Event: Men’s doubles

Current city: Orange

Bio: Pongnairat will make his Olympic debut with doubles partner Phillip Chew. The duo won gold at the 2015 Pan American Games in Toronto and are ranked No. 35 in the world rankings as of July 21.

HOWARD SHU

Event: Men’s singles

Hometown: Anaheim

Bio: Shu will compete in his first Olympic Games after a bronze-medal finish at the 2015 Pan American Games in Toronto. He is ranked No. 62 in the world rankings as of July 21.

BASKETBALL

KLAY THOMPSON

Hometown: Los Angeles

High school: Santa Margarita (Rancho Santa Margarita)

Bio: Thompson will represent USA Basketball in the Olympics for the first time in Rio after helping the U.S. win a gold medal at the 2014 FIBA World Cup in Spain. The Santa Margarita graduate helped the Golden State Warriors to their first NBA championship in four decades in 2015 before setting a record 73-win regular season in 2016.

GYMNASTICS

LOGAN DOOLEY

Event: Trampoline

Hometown: Lake Forest

High school: El Toro

Bio: An alternate at Beijing in 2008 and London in 2012, Dooley will finally make his Olympic debut for Team USA. The 28-year-old is a six-time world championships team member and finished seventh in the 2015 Pan American Games in Toronto.

SAM MIKULAK

Event: Artistic

Hometown: Newport Beach

High school: Corona del Mar High

Bio: Mikulak represented Team USA in London where he notched fifth-place finishes in vault and team. He will be joined by two other 2012 Olympians, Jake Dalton and John Orozco. Mikulak most recently won gold in the team and individual all-around at the 2015 Pan American Games.

SAILING

CHARLIE BUCKINGHAM

Event: Laser

Hometown: Newport Beach

High school: Newport Harbor

Club: Newport Harbor Yacht Club

Bio: Buckingham will make his Olympic debut in Rio, securing the lone Team USA spot in the one-man dinghy with his overall results on the U.S. Sailing Olympic Athlete Series. He is the current North American champion in the men’s Laser class.

SWIMMING

TOM SHIELDS

Event: 100, 200 butterfly

Hometown: Huntington Beach

High school: Edison

Bio: Shields qualified for his first Olympic Games with runner-up finishes in the 100 and 200-meter fly at the 2016 U.S. Olympic Team Trials.

TENNIS

STEVE JOHNSON

Event: Singles and doubles

Hometown: Orange

High school: Orange

College: USC

Bio: Johnson won two NCAA singles titles for USC and helped the Trojans win four national team titles during a stellar college career. He’s won one ATP Tour level title, on grass at Nottingham. His pro career has generally been on the rise since he left USC in 2-012. He’s an excellent doubles player as well.

TRACK & FIELD

CHRIS BENARD

Event: Triple jump

Hometown: Corona

Birthplace: Tustin

High school: Santiago

Bio: Chris Benard will make his Olympic debut after qualifying with a third-place 56 feet, 5¾ inches mark at the U.S. Olympic Team Trials in July. He owns the fifth-best mark in the world for 2016 as of July 26.

CHARLES JOCK

Event: 800 meters

Hometown: San Diego

High school: Mission Bay

College: UC Irvine

Bio: Jock secured his first Olympic berth at the U.S. Olympic Team Trials in July with a 1:45.48 third-place finish. The three-time All-American is the first UCI Track product to qualify for the Games since three-time Olympian Steve Scott in 1988.

AMEER WEBB

Event: 200 meters

High school: Tustin High

Bio: Webb finished fifth in the 200 at the 2009 CIF state meet running for Tustin High. He went from there to Cerritos College, where he was the state champion in both the 100 and 200 in 2011. His next stop was Texas A&M, where he was the NCAA Div. I indoor champion in the 200 in 2013.

VOLLEYBALL

JAKE GIBB

Event: Beach volleyball

Residence: Huntington Beach

Bio: Gibb, who was born in Utah, will be competing in his third Olympic Games. He finished fifth in both 2008 and 2012 while partnering with Sean Rosenthal. He and partner Casey Patterson are seeded sixth at the Olympics.

RUSSELL HOLMES

Event: Indoor volleyball (middle blocker)

Hometown: Fountain Valley

High school: Fountain Valley High

Bio: Holmes, who was born in Anaheim, was the leading blocker on the 2012 U.S. Olympic team. He was a member of the U.S. team that won the 2015 FIVB World Cup, and was a two-time AVCA All-American at BYU. He has competed for pro teams in Austria and Brazil.

JAYSON JABLONSKY

Event: Indoor volleyball (outside hitter)

Hometown: Yorba Linda

High school: Esperanza High

College: UC Irvine

Bio: Jablonsky, who was an alternate for the 2012 U.S. Olympic Team, helped the U.S. win gold at the 2016 FIVB World Cup. While at UC Irvine he was named 2006 AVCA and MPSF Player of the Year in 2006 and helped the Anteaters win the 2007 NCAA National Championship. He also was a member Esperanza’s 2002 Div. I CIF Championship team.

CASEY PATTERSON

Event: Beach volleyball

Hometown: Huntington Beach

Bio: Patterson, a first-time Olympian at the age of 36, formed a partnership with two-time Olympian Jake Gibb in 2013 with the goal of medalling in Rio. The duo capped that three-year journey with the Manhattan Beach Open title on July 17, adding it to a fifth-place finish at the 2015 Beach World Championships. He and Gibb are seeded sixth in the Olympic pool.

APRIL ROSS

Event: Beach volleyball

Hometown: Costa Mesa

High school: Newport Harbor

College: USC

Bio: Ross teamed with Kerri Walsh-Jennings after the three-time Olympic gold medalist parted ways with Misty May-Treanor upon her retirement following the London Games. They are after gold in Rio and are seeded third in the Olympic pool. Together they won four gold, two silver and two bronze during the qualification period. Ross won silver with former partner Jennifer Kessy in London in 2012.

TAYLOR SANDER

Event: Indoor volleyball (outside hitter)

Hometown: Huntington Beach

Bio: Sander will make his Olympic Games debut for the U.S. Men’s National Team after helping them win the 2015 FIVB World Cup title, qualifying for Rio. The Norco High product won Most Valuable Player and Best Spiker of the 2014 FIVB World League Final Round as the U.S. won gold, his first year with the team.

DAVID SMITH

Event: Indoor volleyball (middle blocker)

Hometown: Saugus

High school: Saugus

College: UC Irvine

Bio: Smith and the U.S. Men’s National Team finished fifth at the London Olympics in 2012. He returns for his second Games after helping the U.S. qualify for Rio with the 2015 FIVB World Cup title.

WATER POLO

McQUIN BARON

Position: Goalkeeper

Hometown: North Tustin

High school: Mater Dei

College: USC

Bio: Baron will make his Olympic debut in Rio. Baron and the U.S. Men’s National Team claimed a silver medal in the 2016 FINA World League Super Final, where Baron posted 29 saves. He added 14 saves in the 2015 Pan American Games with Team USA winning gold.

BRET BONANNI

Position: Attacker

Hometown: Huntington Beach

High school: Mater Dei

Bio: Bonanni will make his Olympic debut in Rio. He led Team USA’s offence with 18 goals during their Gold-medal finish at 2015 Pan American Games and connected three goals in 2016 FINA World League Super Final.

LUCA CUPIDO

Position: Attacker

Current city: Newport Beach

High school: Newport Harbor

Bio: Cupido, a native of Italy, played at Newport Harbor High, where he was named a First-Team All- American in 2013. He attends Cal, where he earned Newcomer of the Year honors in the Mountain Pacific Sports Federation in 2014. This is his first Olympics.

RACHEL FATTAL

Position: Attacker

Hometown: Seal Beach

High school: Los Alamitos

College: UCLA

Bio: It will be Fattal’s first Olympic Games in Rio. The 22-year old scored seven goals in 2016 FINA World League Super Final and aided Team USA’s qualification for the 2016 Olympics by posting six goals. Rattal scored eight goals at 2016 FINA Intercontinental Tournament, helping Team USA win a Gold medal. She was named 2015 FINA World Championship’s MVP.

ARIA FISCHER

Position: Attacker

Hometown: Laguna Beach

High school: Laguna Beach

Bio: Fischer will make her Olympic debut in Rio. The 17-year-old scored four goals in the 2016 FINA World League Super Final and posted 11 goals during Team USA’s qualification for the 2016 Olympic games. Fischer connected on five goals, helping Team USA to a Gold medal at 2016 FINA Intercontinental Tournament.

MAKENZIE FISHER

Position: Attacker

Hometown: Laguna Beach

High school: Laguna Beach

Bio: Fischer signed a National Letter of Intent with Stanford in fall of 2014, and deferred her enrollment. She will begin her freshman season during the 2016-17 academic year. She added six goals in 2016 FINA World League Super Final and helped Team USA qualify for the 2016 Olympic Games with 24 goals. The 19-year-old led Team USA to Gold with 13 goals at 2016 FINA Intercontinental Tournament.

KALEIGH GILCHRIST

Position: Attacker

Hometown: Newport Beach

High school: Newport Harbor

College: USC

Bio: Gilchrist will play in her first Olympic games after scoring five goals to help Team USA qualify for the 2016 Olympic games and posted four goals in 2016 FINA World League Super Final. She won an NCAA Championship at USC in 2013 and was named ACWPC All-American Second team in 2014. She also won U.S. Surfing Championship in 2009 and 2010.

JOHN MANN

Position: Center

Hometown: Newport Beach

High school: Corona del Mar

Bio: Mann is an Olympic verteran after playing in the 2012 Olympic Games in London where Team USA came in 8th place. He has competed professionally since 2014 for a France-based club, C.N. Marseille, where he aided the team that won the French National Championship in 2015. He scored twice in 2016 FINA World League Super Final and tallied three goals in Team USA’s Gold medal finish at 2015 Pan American Games.

COURTNEY MATHEWSON

Position: Attacker

Hometown: Anaheim Hills

High school: Canyon

College: UCLA

Bio: Mathewson and Team USA won a Gold medal in the 2012 Olympic Games in London. She scored six foals in 2016 FINA World League Super Final and posted five goals during Team USA’s qualification for the Olympic Games in Rio. She was the second highest scorer for Team USA during 2015 Pan American Games, where she tallied 14 goals.

MADDIE MUSSELMAN

Position: Attacker

Hometown: Newport Beach

High school: Corona del Mar

Bio: Musselman scored 11 goals in 2016 FINA World League Super Final and added 13 goals to help Team USA qualify for the 2016 Olympic Games in Rio. The 18-year-old posted nine goals to help Team USA to a Gold-medal finish at 2016 FINA intercontinental Tournament and tallied nine goals at 2015 Pan American Games, where Team USA won Gold.

JOSH SAMUELS

Position: Attacker

Hometown: Villa Park

High school: Villa Park

College: UCLA

Bio: Samuels scored over 100 goals while competing collegiately at UCLA. He scored six goals in 2016 FINA World League Super Final and posted 11 goals in 2016 FINA Intercontinental Tournament. He also helped Team USA win the Gold-medal at 2015 Pan American Games where he recorded 12 goals. He competed for club team Budva in Montenegro in 2013-2014.

WRESTLING

HELEN MAROULIS

Weight class: 53 kg/116.5 lb

Residence: Huntington Beach

High school: Marquette, Mich.

Club: Sunkist Kids

Bio: Maroulis was a gold medalist at the 2015 World Wrestling Championships and a gold medalist at the 2011 Pan American Games. She is a six-time U.S. Open Champion and four-time WCWA Women’s College National Champion.

CANOE/KAYAK

MAGGIE HOGAN

Event: Canoe sprint (single kayak, 500m)

Hometown: Huntington Beach

Club: Newport Aquatic Center

Bio: Hogan qualified for her first Olympic Games in canoe sprint with a second-place finish in the women’s single kayak 500-meter event at the 2016 Pan American Sprint Canoe/Kayak Championships in May. The 14-time national champion swam collegiately at UC Santa Barbara.

OC ATHLETES COMPETING FOR OTHER COUNTRIES

Persis William-Mensah, UC Irvine – Ghana track (4×100)

Tubotein Taylor, Anaheim (Canyon HS), Mt. SAC – Nigeria track

Kevin Tillie, UC Irvine – France volleyball
